widgets_values: China is located in East Asia, situated at the eastern part of the Asian continent, and is the world's most populous country. It is bordered by 14 countries: Afghanistan to the northwest, Pakistan to the southwest, India to the west, Bhutan and Nepal to the west-southwest, Myanmar (Burma), Laos, and Vietnam to the southwest, Russia and Mongolia to the north, North Korea to the east, and Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, and Tajikistan to the northwest. To the east and south, China faces the East China Sea, Korea Bay, Yellow Sea, and South China Sea, bordering Japan, the Philippines, Malaysia, and Brunei across the seas. China's vast territory stretches from the East China Sea in the east to the Pamir Mountains in the west, and from the northern border with Russia and Mongolia in the north to the southern border with Vietnam, Laos, and Myanmar in the south.
